item.title: Python Fun
item.description: Learning python for the first time has been super fun and interesting. Here is an example of indexing with python: list=['rooster','wombat','whale','cat','hedgehog'] list[3:] ## ['cat', 'hedgehog'] The code returns elements after index 3 (first element is 0). source: https://www.instagram.com/mr.pokee/ Hereâ€™s how python and R can interact with each other: library(reticulate) q<-"SDS" q="348" print(r.q,q) ## SDS 348 cat(c(q,py$q)) ## SDS 348
